description.title: Weekly Goals
description.description: Achieve steady improvements in accuracy and reasoning across prioritized Reading & Writing and Math skills, focusing on mastering the most difficult question types under timed conditions. Reduce repeat mistakes by identifying patterns in errors and applying refined strategies to minimize score variance. Build endurance and confidence by simulating full test conditions, maintaining calm and mental control throughout. Lock in effective test-taking strategies to ensure consistent performance near the 1590 goal.

description.title: Reading & Writing
description.description: Central Ideas and Details, Inferences, Rhetorical Synthesis, Cross-text Connections, Command of Evidence - Quantitative

description.title: Math
description.description: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units, Linear inequalities in one or two variables, Percentages, One-variable data: Distributions and measures of center and spread

description.Central Ideas and Details: Practice timed passage readings where after each paragraph, pause to annotate the central idea and supporting details, then summarize the entire passage in your own words to reinforce comprehension and speed under pressure.
description.Inferences: Engage with SAT-style inference questions by annotating passages for subtle clues like tone and word choice, then justify each inference by citing explicit text evidence, building confidence in drawing well-supported conclusions quickly.
description.Rhetorical Synthesis: Work on paired passages by identifying agreements and contrasts, then write brief synthesis paragraphs using transitional phrases to connect ideas, focusing on clarity and logical flow under timed conditions.
description.Cross-text Connections: Use graphic organizers to compare authorâ€™s purpose, tone, and evidence across paired texts, then answer synthesis questions that require integrating information, emphasizing accuracy and pattern recognition.
description.Command of Evidence - Quantitative: Practice interpreting embedded graphs and tables by highlighting key data points, then answer command of evidence questions step-by-step, verifying each choice against the passage to avoid misinterpretation.

description.Ratios, rates, proportional relationship: Solve multi-step word problems involving ratios and unit conversions under timed conditions, writing out each step with units to ensure accuracy and build fluency in dimensional analysis.
description.Linear inequalities in one or two variab: Translate real-world scenarios into inequalities, solve them carefully while tracking sign changes, and graph solutions on number lines to visualize ranges and confirm correctness.
description.Percentages: Practice complex percentage problems including increases, decreases, and reverse calculations, writing out each step clearly and estimating results to check for reasonableness under timed practice.
description.One-variable data: Distributions and mea: Analyze data sets by calculating mean, median, range, and IQR, then interpret box plots and histograms to identify distribution shape and outliers, reinforcing conceptual understanding with timed drills.

description.title: Weekly Structure
description.description: Each weekday focuses on dual-skill practice pairing one Math and one Reading & Writing skill, starting the week with the weakest skills to address plateaus early, progressing to moderate skills midweek, and dedicating Fridays to comprehensive review and error analysis. Saturdays include two full-length, timed practice tests simulating real exam conditions to build endurance and confidence, followed by detailed review sessions to identify patterns and refine strategies. Sundays serve as a Flex Day to support rest, reflection, and adaptive learning.

description.title: Flex Day Activities
description.description: Engage in low-pressure reflection by reviewing errors from the week to identify growth opportunities without judgment. Experiment with new study tools or techniques, such as digital annotation apps or timed flashcard games, to gamify learning and gently push comfort zones. Participate in mixed-skill challenges with peers slightly ahead in intensity to boost motivation while maintaining harmony. Incorporate mindfulness or light physical activity to restore mental balance. Set clear, achievable goals for the upcoming week, framing challenges as growth opportunities rather than stressors.
